II.iii.2.A.4.b
.
Validating the Accuracy of ITF Data in the Corporate Record
Claims processors are responsible for validating the accuracy of data in the corporate record regarding a claimant’s communication of an ITF.
When inaccurate ITF information exists and a correction is being made on
the same day that the ITF was created, but prior to the daily ITF batch run, follow the procedures in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.A.4.c
, or
a different day than the ITF was created or after the daily batch run, follow the procedures in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.A.4.d
.
Notes
:
The daily ITF batch run refers to the system process that occurs once daily in the evening to update ITF statuses.  If an attempt to update an ITF status is made after the daily ITF batch run begins, a system message will appear indicating that the user does not have the authority to make changes to ITF status.
In situations where an ITF is expressed to a VA employee, the data is transcribed directly into the CRM system and/or the corporate record and need not be separately documented on
VA Form 21-0966
or
VA Form 27-0820
, as described in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.A.2.a
and
d
.
In these situations, additional validation is not necessary as no separate data will exist to use for validation.
